abstract.t: This document specifies the URI (Uniform Resource Identifier) scheme "about". About URIs describe resources within a browser or other software interpreting URIs.

section.title: Description
section.t: About URIs provide a namespace for browsers and other URI interpreters to expose implementation specific information. While any number of existing schemes could be used to identify such resources, about URIs have become the de facto standard. Browsers already use the about scheme. The about:blank URI is ubiquitous, and some browsers also provide other resources with the about scheme, including about:cache and about:version. A frighteningly large list of about URIs .
About URIs are also more memorable than an equivalent urn or tag URI. Using an http URI would not only be less memorable, but also longer and semantically confusing.
EDITORS NOTE: It may be reasonable to also define an about URN scheme and define about URIs as a provisional shorthand for those URNs.

Some applications need to have identifiers to system resources. It is often reasonable to leave the interpretation of a resource up to the implementation. Generally these will be resources within the application.
EDITOR'S NOTE: Contrast these to file URIs
About URIs are useful because they identify resources the browser does not need to retrieve.
Since about is already in use by most browsers, using an unknown about URI as a SYSTEM identifier is generally more compatible with SGML parsers than an unknown PUBLIC identifier.

section.title: Security Considerations
section.t: There is no guarantee that an application will understand any about URI provided to it. An about URI may not resolve to the expected resource. If the reference is unlikely to resolve correctly, the reference should be accompanied by an explanation or alternatives.

Some applications are known to display arbitrary HTML following the scheme. Applications should be cautious when accessing an about URI. An application should not execute or display information in an about URI. About URIs should not cause the application to modify any data. Applications should not use about URIs to access files or other sensitive information.
About URIs may identify resources which show private information. This sensitive information should never be included in about URIs.
